parameters.content: ## Webhook Trigger when the Customer create order

## Code Extract Order Information
Reads the order from the incoming webhook or payload.

Pulls customer, shipping, billing, and line item details.

Financial Summary
Grabs totals like:

Subtotal

Shipping

Tax

Discounts

Grand Total

Also collects the order currency.

Calculate Line Totals
Computes:

Total value of all products

Total value of only taxable products

Format the Billing Address
Combines billing info into one clean string:
Name, Phone, Email, Address, City, State, Zip, Country.

Base Order Info
Stores reusable order-level data:

Order ID, number, status

Customer name, email, phone

Financial and shipping info

Product-Level Breakdown
For each product (line item):

Calculates:

Line total (price × quantity)

Allocated tax & shipping

% of order value

Extracts:

Color, Size, Material (from variant title)

SKU, Vendor, Variant ID, Product ID

Whether the item is taxable or needs shipping

# Airtable Customer Sheet

## Listing out total rows of customer sheet

## Return Only Last Row
Purpose: Get the last item from all incoming rows and pass it forward.

📌 How it works:

$input.all() → Fetches all incoming items.

rows[rows.length - 1] → Picks the last item.

return [lastRow]; → Sends only the last row to the next node.

📦 Use Case:
Use when you only want to process or forward the latest record

# Auto-Increment "S No" from Previous Node
## Take the serial number (S No) from previous node data, increment it by 1, and return the updated data.

📌 How it works:

Reads the first item from the input.

Checks for "S No"  field.

If missing or invalid, uses 0 as default.

Adds +1 to generate the new serial number.

Returns the full original data + updated "S No" field.

# Airtable Sheet
## Appending data in Airtable of new Customer Sheet

## This automation is built in n8n (a no-code/low-code automation platform). It automatically updates order data into system every time when a customer places an order on your Shopify store.

No manual copy-pasting. No missing data. Everything gets updated in real time.

### 🔧 What This Automation Does:

This flow listens for new Shopify orders, extracts detailed order data, and organizes it into customer sheets and sales record databases automatically — without any manual entry.


---

🔄 Step-by-Step Technical Flow

1. Trigger: Shopify Webhook

Node Type: Webhook (Trigger)

Function: Listens for new order events from Shopify whenever a customer places an order.



2. Code Execution: Clean Order Data

Node Type: Code (JavaScript)

Function:

Extracts raw order and customer data.

Normalizes and organizes:

Financials: subtotal, tax, shipping, grand total

Customer info: name, email, phone

Addresses: billing/shipping in clean text

Line items: price, quantity, SKU, vendor, variant breakdown


Allocates tax and shipping per item.




3. Airtable: Check for Existing Customer

Node Type: Airtable (Search Records)

Function: Checks if the customer already exists in the Airtable "Customer Sheet" using email as a unique identifier.



4. Route Based on Customer Status

Node Type: IF Node

Function:

If customer exists, continue to update records.

If customer does not exist, add them as a new customer.




5. Auto-Increment for Sales ID / Sales Row ID

Node Type: Code

Function:

Automatically generates a new unique ID for the order entry (useful for Airtable).

Helps with sorting, linking, and reporting.




6. Airtable: Insert into Customer and Sales Tables

Node Type: Airtable (Create Record)

Function:

Adds the cleaned data (including per-item details) to the Sales Sheet.

Optionally adds or updates the Customer Sheet.






---

📈 How This Helps You Grow

✅ 1. Real-Time, Zero-Touch Order Sync

No more exporting Shopify orders manually. The moment someone buys, it’s logged and structured in your database.

✅ 2. Clean & Structured Data for Every Order

You get detailed records with:

Customer insights

Product breakdowns (color, size, etc.)

Allocated costs This is critical for sales reporting, analytics, and re-engagement campaigns.


✅ 3. Scalable Customer Management

By syncing customer data automatically, you maintain a growing, accurate database that can power:

Email/SMS marketing tools

Loyalty systems

CRMs and dashboards


✅ 4. Saves Time, Reduces Errors

Manual entry is not only time-consuming but also risky. This automation prevents human mistakes and saves you 10–20 hours a week.

✅ 5. Smart Auto-Numbering System

Automatically assigns sales IDs or tracking numbers — no need to remember or create your own sequence.

✅ 6. Ready for Advanced Automation

This system forms the foundation for future automations, such as:

Triggering shipping workflows

Connecting with accounting tools

Advanced profit/loss tracking



---

🧩 Summary

> “This automation is like hiring a full-time assistant to process your orders, manage your customer list, and organize your sales data — but it works 24/7, never sleeps, and never makes a mistake.”



You can grow confidently, knowing your backend operations are running smoothly and ready to scale.
